JobFullDesc: About the Role  Uber has recently launched Uber Direct, a last-mile, on-demand, delivery service for business customers. The last-mile delivery market is estimated to be worth upwards of $7.5b AUD in Australia, with rapidly increasing consumer preference for on-demand services. Uber Direct has the potential to support on-demand delivery across a range of customer verticals - restaurants, supermarkets, non-food retailers, and many more use cases yet to be discovered. In this role, you will build and maintain excellent operational processes, lead strategic initiatives, and support the growth of Uber Direct. You’ll need to be willing to both roll up your sleeves, and lead high profile and complex initiatives at the same time.  What You'll Do: Develop new operational processes to support next hour delivery. These could relate to efficient merchant onboarding, providing excellent customer support, or ensuring delivery person safety.Solve broad and ambiguous problems relating to the launch and operations of Uber Direct across Australia and New Zealand. Work closely with the global product team on new feature releases for Uber Direct. Prepare local launch plans, and work through localisation and regulatory review where necessary.Monitor operational performance of Uber Direct, and identify opportunities for process improvement across the end to end product. Support merchants and our commercial teams on driving adoption of on-demand delivery across Australia. What You'll Need A proven track record: You'll have 5+ years of business management, operations, sales, or sales operations experience in a dynamic environment.A self-starter who thrives in ambiguity: Launching a new business isn't easy, and there isn't an existing plan for you to follow. You'll have the support of your manager and cross-functional partners, however you'll need to be the one driving this forward.Experienced in programme and stakeholder management: You'll need to oversee multiple workstreams and engage stakeholders from across the organisation.Attention to detail, and a willingness to 'roll up your sleeves': You'll need to be across detailed operational metrics (e.g. what % of trips failed last week?), and jump into the weeds when things "just need to get done" (e.g. prospecting leads, building reporting dashboards, configuring product settings, etc.)Customer obsession: You won't be expected to know everything (yet), however you'll have a strong appetite to understand and learn the industries and customers you're targeting and the experience they're having on the platform.Previous experience in last-mile (shipper or carrier side) or general logistics is a plus, but not required.Previous experience working in or with B2B sales teams is a plus but not required.
